intro: Jaltomata oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement, where leaves are paired along the stem. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Jaltomata oppositifolia is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like tomatoes and peppers.
